alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Eastern Lincoln County; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northeast Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 2:01PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...POTENTIAL FOR DENSE FOG AND FREEZING FOG LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MID TOMORROW MORNING... Fog and freezing fog is expected to develop across parts of central New Mexico late tonight persisting through the mid morning hours of Saturday. The favored locations will be across areas that observed precipitation last night into this morning including Socorro and the Albuquerque and Santa Fe metros, and the east slopes of the central mountain chain and adjacent highlands including Las Vegas, Clines Corners, Moriarty, Estancia, Edgewood, and Ruidoso. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities, and allow for extra time to reach their destinations tonight into Saturday morning. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
